timeseries.models

Interface Model

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Arima, MeanModel, RandomWalk

    public interface Model
    A representation of a time series model. A time series model is an attempt to capture the essential characteristics of the process or processes underlying the time series.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TimeSeries fittedSeries()
      Get the model fitted values, which are in-sample one-step ahead forecasts.
      default Forecast forecast(int steps)
      Produce a new forecast up to the given number of steps with an α significance level of 0.05 for computing prediction intervals.
      Forecast forecast(int steps, double alpha)
      Produce a new forecast up to the given number of steps with the given α significance level for computing prediction intervals.
      default void plotFit()
      Plot the model fit, which often displays the model fitted values and the observations in the same plot area.
      default void plotResiduals()
      Plot the model residuals.
      TimeSeries pointForecast(int steps)
      Produce a time series of point forecasts from this model up to the given number of steps ahead.
      TimeSeries residuals()
      Get the model residuals, the difference between the observed values and the model fitted values.
      TimeSeries timeSeries()
      Get the series of observations.

    • Method Detail

      • pointForecast

        TimeSeries pointForecast(int steps)
        Produce a time series of point forecasts from this model up to the given number of steps ahead.

        To obtain additional information about the forecast, such as prediction intervals, use the forecast(int, double) method and the resulting Forecast object.

        Parameters:
        steps - the number of time periods ahead to forecast.
        Returns:
        a time series of point forecasts from this model up to the given number of steps ahead.

      • forecast

        Forecast forecast(int steps,
                  double alpha)
        Produce a new forecast up to the given number of steps with the given α significance level for computing prediction intervals.
        Parameters:
        steps - the number of time periods ahead to forecast.
        alpha - the probability that a future observation will fall outside the associated (1 - α)100% prediction interval, given that the model is "correct". Note that the correctness of the model often comes with a high degree of uncertainty and this should be taken into account when making decisions. In other words, the provided prediction intervals will often be overly optimistic.
        Returns:
        a new forecast up to the given number of steps ahead with the given significance level.

      • forecast

        default Forecast forecast(int steps)
        Produce a new forecast up to the given number of steps with an α significance level of 0.05 for computing prediction intervals.
        Parameters:
        steps - the number of time periods ahead to forecast.
        Returns:
        a new forecast up to the given number of steps ahead with a 0.05 α significance level.

      • timeSeries

        TimeSeries timeSeries()
        Get the series of observations.
        Returns:
        the series of observations.

      • fittedSeries

        TimeSeries fittedSeries()
        Get the model fitted values, which are in-sample one-step ahead forecasts.
        Returns:
        the model fitted values.

      • residuals

        TimeSeries residuals()
        Get the model residuals, the difference between the observed values and the model fitted values.
        Returns:
        the model residuals.

      • plotFit

        default void plotFit()
        Plot the model fit, which often displays the model fitted values and the observations in the same plot area.

      • plotResiduals

        default void plotResiduals()
        Plot the model residuals.
